content: this is a quick and simple pattern to crochet a little stylised daffodil the pattern uses only chain and slip_stitch so it is the same in uk and us crochet terminologies you will need 1m yellow 4 ply/fingering weight yarn i like a non- superwash 100% wool yarn so that it blooms on soaking to make a nice solid flower i used jamieson s spindrift in shade daffodil 1m green yarn i used jamieson s spindrift in shade leprechaun 1 5mm hook needle optional- 2mm double pointed needles tiny daffodil instructions make a magic_ring and slip_stitch into the magic_ring chain 4 slip_stitch into magic_ring x 5 chain 4 then close into a ring by slip stitching into the very first slip_stitch cut the yarn and pull through leaving a tail of c 12cm using your cast on tail very gently pull the magic loop closed if you have a yarn such as spindrift that easily breaks under gauge use lots of gentle little tugs use the crochet hook to pull the cast on tail to the other side through the centre this is now the back of the flower now make the daffodil s trumpet pull the cast off bind off yarn tail through the centre to the other side now the front of the flower slip_stitch under a yarn loop near the centre of the flower chain 4 slip_stitch into a loop near the centre of the other side of the flower pull this yarn tail through the centre of the flower to the back gently pull tight and knot with the other yarn tail here sew the ends into the back of the flower block the daffodil to get the best shape soak in warm water squish water out in a towel and pin out to dry gently pulling the petals out and pinning through the daffodil s trumpet using a free pin to pull the trumpet tall stem you can either crochet or knit your stem crochet using a 1 5mm hook make a slipknot then chain 10 cut yarn and pull through sew onto back of daffoldil lose the yarn tails by sewing it into the daffodil stem you can alternatively start your chain by slipstitching under a couple of yarn loops on the centre back of the daffodil flower knit using fine double pointed needles e g 2 0mm pick up two stitch loops from near the centre of the back of the daffodil work 10 row of two stitch i-cord from the picked up stitches cast off bind off and sew the yarn tail into the stem you can alternatively start your i-cord by casting on two stitches and sewing the stem onto the daffodil would you like your stem stiffer the crocheted stem isn t very stiff- you can stiffen it by soaking it with dilute pva glue white glue 1 1 ratio and allowing to dry alternatively you could wet felt your stem
